text:
9˚Now
  concerning brotherly love
    you have no need for anyone to write to you,
    for you yourselves have been taught by God
                                 to love one another,
10˚for that indeed is what you are doing
     to all the brothers
                throughout Macedonia.
   But we urge you, brothers,
       to do this more and more,
    11˚and to aspire to live quietly,
       and to mind your own affairs,
       and to work with your hands,
       as we instructed you,
       12˚so that you may walk properly before outsiders
          and be dependent on no one.

God: Teaches the church to love one another
Author: Urged the Thessalonians to love one another even more
instructed the church to live quietly
instructed the church to mind their own affairs
instructed the church to work with their hands
didn't want the church to be dependent on anyone
Audience: were taught by God to love one another
were doing well at loving all the brothers throughout Macedonia
were instructed to love others even more
were instructed to mind their own affairs
were instructed to work with their own hands
were instructed to walk properly before outsiders
were instructed to be dependent on no one

keywords.brotherly love: This concept is the hinge of the passage as it marks the main quality of commondation of the church, the main drive which fueled other honorable practices, and a main quality of testimony to the region. And so, it makes sense that Paul would compliment on this matter while urging them to continue in it more and more.

points: The Thessalonians were doing very well concerning brotherly love
There was reason to encourage the church to show love even more
Paul encouraged the church to be responsible and respectable
The church's lifestyle was to be a testimony to the non-church
The church's lifestyle was to be free from dependence on the non-church
